text: Jean Henri Dunant was a Swiss businessman and social activist. A book he wrote influenced the International Committee of the Red Cross to be formed in 1863.Our History the founder of International Committee of the red cross, The 1864 Geneva Convention was based on Dunant's ideas. In 1901 he received the first Nobel Peace Prize together with Frédéric Passy.Henry Dunant, The Nobel Prize == References == Category:1828 births Category:1910 deaths Category:Nobel Peace Prize winners Category:People from Geneva Category:Swiss businesspeople Category:Swiss Nobel Prize winners
title: Henry Dunant
